en: That’s better.
zh: 現在好多了。

en: In a way it’s a good thing too, because you know Sandra has been looking for it.
zh: 某種意義上說，這是一件好事，因為你知道桑德拉一直在找它。

en: Henry can explain it better. Of course Henry has never been that great at writing from the female point of view (You just don’t get women, Henry— because you’re a chauvinistic asshole, according to one cat-loving, manhating blogger), but he’s willing, if you are, Future Jerry, to let him give it a shot. Henry?
zh: 亨利可以更好地解釋這事，亨利不擅長從女性的角度寫作（一個喜愛貓咪、仇視男性的博主說你只是不懂女人，亨利，因為你是個大男子主義者），但未來的傑瑞，如果你肯給他一個機會讓他試一下的話，亨利是可以很好解釋的。

en: It was dark outside. Rain hammered the shit out of the roof, it hammered the shit out of the windows.
zh: 外面一片昏暗，淅淅瀝瀝的雨點敲打著屋頂和門窗。

en: Sandra sat at the window thinking about how, once her husband was gone, she wouldn’t have to sneak out to spread her legs for people in the back of cars and in restaurant toilets, because that was all very what her mother would call unladylike.
zh: 桑德拉坐在窗口，心裏想著即便她丈夫出去了，她也不會溜出去的，不會在汽車尾座或在餐廳洗手間里對著人張開雙腿，她母親把這種行為稱為「不守婦道」。

en: She was looking forward to spending all of Jerry’s money—oh, the things she would buy!
zh: 她盼望著花光傑瑞的錢，她會大肆採購的。

en: And poor Jerry, sitting in a nursing home with a feeding tube jammed up his ass because that’s the way she asked them to do it—sure, it cost extra, but it was money well spent because it amused her, the same way Jerry amused her when he got confused or lost.
zh: 到時，可憐的傑瑞會坐在療養院里，屁股插著餵食管，她要求他們這樣做的，當然這還需要額外付費，但這錢花得值，因為這讓她愉悅，同樣地，傑瑞犯糊塗或走丟的時候她也會感到愉悅。

en: The wedding was approaching, and she was hoping his mind would have reached full collapse by then, not only because she was scared about him forgetting who his daughter was when he gave her away and embarrassing Eva, but because there was going to be a lot of cock at that reception and she was definitely up for her share.
zh: 婚禮快到了，她希望到時他的腦子會完全死機，她就怕他在把女兒送到男方手上的時候會忘了女兒是誰，到時候滿場賓朋，這得多尷尬啊，她肯定得承擔她的責任。

en: She was curious as to what Jerry was up to.
zh: 她很好奇，不知道傑瑞會做什麼。

en: Planning on sneaking back over the road to Mrs. Smith’s house?
zh: 打算溜回史密斯太太家裡去嗎？

en: She wondered what he would do next, and concluded he was going to rape the old lady. It would be such a classic Jerry thing to do.
zh: 她不知道他下一步的打算，但她猜測他會去強|奸老太太，這是傑瑞的典型做法。

en: There was a flash of lightning and the night sky lit up, she saw her reflection in the window, her cheating whore face looking back, and she slipped out of her chair and was at the door to Jerry’s office when the thunder struck, so loud and so close she held her breath and waited for the pictures to fall off the walls, and when they didn’t, she opened the office door, stepped inside, and closed it behind her.
zh: 一道閃電划亮了夜空，她看見了自己倒映在窗戶上的身影，她那張騙人的婊子臉也回望著她。她從椅子上滑下來，來到傑瑞寫作房的門口。電閃雷鳴，彷彿就在耳畔炸開一樣，她屏住呼吸，等待著閃電把牆上的壁畫劈下來，然而它們沒有。她打開寫作房的門走了進去，隨手關上身後的門。

en: She checked the couch where she thought Jerry was spending too much time—behind the cushions, under the couch, then she sighed, pushed the desk aside, used the screwdriver from Jerry’s drawer to lift the floorboard, and reached under.
zh: 她在抽屜里找他的「狂人日記」，但裏面沒有。她又檢查了沙發，她知道傑瑞在那兒待的時間最多，靠墊後面、沙發底下，都沒有。她嘆了口氣，推開辦公桌，從傑瑞的抽屜里拿出螺絲刀撬開地板，把手伸進去……她的計劃是閱讀日記，並撕掉幾頁，這樣他就會忘記已經寫到哪兒了。

en: It amused her to screw with him.
zh: 這麼擺弄他讓她很開心。

en: “What are you doing?”
zh: 「你在做什麼？」

en: “I’m worried about you, Jerry,” she said, pulling her arm out as though withdrawing it from the mouth of a shark, but what she really meant was I wish you didn’t live here anymore.
zh: 「我有點兒擔心你，傑瑞。」說著她把手收回來，像是從鯊魚口裡收回一樣，但她真正想說的是「我真希望你沒有住在這裏。

en: You may be the best-looking man I’ve ever seen, but you’re holding me back.
zh: 你可能是我見過的最英俊的男子，但你拖累了我」。

en: “Are you looking for my journal?”
zh: 「你在找我的日記？」

en: “I want to make sure you’re okay.”
zh: 「我想知道你還好不好。」

en: “It’s my journal!”
zh: 「這是我的日記！」

en: “It’s like a diary, Sandra, you can’t read other people’s diaries.”
zh: 天啊，她怎麼這麼恨他。「那是我的隱私，桑德拉，你不可以偷看別人的日記。」

en: “You said I could.”
zh: 「你說過我可以的。」

en: “When?”
zh: 「我什麼時候說了的？」

en: “A few hours ago,” she said, but it was a lie.
zh: 「幾個小時前。」她說。但她在撒謊。

en: She could say anything now and he couldn’t be sure if she was making it up. She thought about telling him how she had been bumping uglies with Greg from yoga class just to break his heart, then put her theory to the test to prove he wouldn’t remember.
zh: 她想告訴他她和在瑜伽課上認識的格雷格打了一炮只是為了讓他傷心，隨後她就能矢口否認以證明他不會記得的。

en: She wished Greg was here. That guy knew how to bend a body.
zh: 她真希望格雷格在這兒，他知道怎麼可以塑造完美身材。

en: “If that was true, then why are you looking for it?” he asked.
zh: 「如果你說的話是真的，那麼你為什麼還要到處亂翻？」他問，「我為什麼沒有直接把它交給你？」

en: “Because you couldn’t remember where you had put it.”
zh: 「因為你也不記得放在哪裡了。」

en: He nodded then, and she realized something—he really couldn’t remember where he had put it.
zh: 他點了點頭，她意識到什麼——他真的不記得把它放在哪裡了。

en: “I was trying to help you, Jerry.”
zh: 「我想幫你，傑瑞。」

en: “How do I know you’re not lying to me?” he asked, and he started to cry again, and seriously, she was one sobbing fit away from stabbing him in the throat.
zh: 「我怎麼知道你沒有騙我？」他問，接著又號啕大哭起來。說實在的，他要是再抽抽搭搭個沒完，她恨不得一刀割斷他的喉嚨。

en: She reached out and Jerry fell into her embrace, and she started rubbing his back, and she knew he was feeling loved, but really all she was doing was wiping the cobwebs off her fingers from under the floorboards.
zh: 她站了起來，伸出雙臂擁抱傑瑞。她給他搓背，她知道他有一種被愛撫的感覺，但其實她只不過是想擦掉手指上的蜘蛛網。

en: “Would you like me to carry on helping you look for it?”
zh: 「我繼續幫你找，好嗎？」

en: “No,” he said.
zh: 「不用了。」

en: “It’s okay. It’ll show up—it always does.”
zh: 他說，「它會自己出現的，總是這樣的。」

en: “Shall we head back up to bed?
zh: 「我們去睡覺好嗎？

en: Belinda is coming over early in the morning.”
zh: 明天早晨貝琳達很早就會過來的。」

en: “Who’s Belinda?”
zh: 「誰是貝琳達？」

en: She sighed. She had gone through this already. “Belinda is the florist.”
zh: 她嘆了口氣，這種情況她已經麻木了：「貝琳達是花店老闆。」

en: The irony is at that point you really had lost the journal.
zh: 諷刺的是你真的把日記給弄丟了。

en: You’d forgotten all about the hiding place, and there was even an entire day in there (which you spent in bed) that you had forgotten you have a journal.
zh: 你完全忘了藏在哪兒，甚至整整一天（你在床上消磨）你都忘了自己有一本日記。

en: You did find the journal, obviously—it happened without you even thinking about it. It’s where you’ve been hiding the gin. Problem is you’ve been out of gin for the last week.
zh: 你找到了日記，你根本不需要擔心，它就在你藏杜松子酒的地方，可問題是你上個星期就已經喝完了杜松子酒。

en: Hans came over yesterday. You hadn’t invited him because Sandra said you couldn’t see him anymore, but he showed up unannounced and Sandra couldn’t bring herself to ask him to leave.
zh: 昨天漢斯過來了，你並沒有邀請他，因為桑德拉說你不許再見他。

en: You sat out on the deck.
zh: 你們坐在露台上。

en: He was wearing a T-shirt that said Drugs Not Hugs.
zh: 他穿著一件短袖，上面印著「遠離毒品」。

en: Summer is approaching and the days are getting longer, and you need to enjoy every sunset that you can now because you never know when it will be your last—at least the last one you’re conscious of.
zh: 夏天將至，白日越來越漫長，你想欣賞每一抹殘陽，因為你永遠不知道什麼時候會是你最後一次欣賞它，至少趁你還有意識的時候要好好欣賞。

en: Hans, by the way, is coming to the wedding.
zh: 順帶一提，漢斯是來參加婚禮的。

en: Sandra was against it, but ultimately it was Eva’s decision—to her Hans is Uncle Hans. He isn’t Prison Hans.
zh: 桑德拉反對他來，但伊娃決定請他來，對她來說，漢斯是漢斯叔叔，而不是進過監獄的漢斯。

en: When Sandra was somewhere deep inside the house Hans pulled a couple of bottles of gin out of his bag. Here you go, buddy.
zh: 當桑德拉在屋裡別處時，漢斯從包里拿出了兩瓶杜松子酒。

en: But— But nothing, Jerry.
zh: 「不可能的，傑瑞。

en: Trust me, she loves you man, really loves you.
zh: 相信我，她愛你，老兄，她真的愛你。

en: I wish I had somebody in my life who was even a tenth of the woman Sandra is.
zh: 我一生中要是能遇到一個及桑德拉十分之一的女人就知足了。

en: When it comes to love, buddy, you’re the luckiest man in the world.
zh: 說到愛，老兄，你就是世界上最幸運的人。」

en: But— He put his hand out in a stop gesture. He looked annoyed. Seriously, Jerry, don’t piss me off, okay?
zh: 他伸出手，做了個「打住」的手勢，有點兒惱火：「說正經的，傑瑞，不要把我氣死好嗎？

en: You don’t see it because you’re too close, but all of this—it’s hard on her too.
zh: 你自己感覺不到，因為你身在福中不知福。但所有這一切，對她來說都太艱難了。

en: I know Sandra doesn’t like me, but don’t go saying stupid shit like that, okay?
zh: 我知道桑德拉不喜歡我，但不要說這樣的蠢話，好嗎？

en: It’s this bloody Alzheimer’s of yours, buddy, it’s scrambling your brain.
zh: 你這該死的阿爾茨海默病，老兄，它讓你的腦子亂掉了。」

en: Did you set fire to the neighbor’s car?
zh: 「你放火燒了鄰居的車？」

en: He laughed and shook his head.
zh: 他笑著搖了搖頭。

en: You know Hans really well, but even you couldn’t tell if that was a yes or a no.
zh: 你非常了解漢斯，但即便這樣你也說不清他是在默認還是否認。

en: Good news—you found the journal, and you’ve got another week’s worth of gin.
zh: 好消息：你找到日記了，松子酒夠你喝一個星期的。

en: It’s hard to know who to feel more betrayed by, your best friend or your wife.
zh: 很難確定到底誰更有可能背叛你，是你最好的朋友還是你的妻子？

en: His name is Jerry Grey and he’s a crime writer and none of this is real, none of this is real.
zh: 他的名字叫傑瑞·格雷，他是一個犯罪小說家，這一切都不是真的。

en: Blood on Jerry’s hands.
zh: 傑瑞的手上沾滿鮮血。

en: His name is Henry Cutter and he’s a crime writer and none of this is real, and even he’s not real, he’s a figment off Jerry Grey’s imagination.
zh: 他的名字是亨利·卡特，他是一個犯罪小說家，這一切都不是真的，甚至他自己也不是真的，他是傑瑞·格雷憑想象虛構的人物。

en: Jerry uses him to make money. Jerry uses him to tell stories.
zh: 傑瑞借他來賺錢，傑瑞借他講故事。

en: Blood on Jerry’s shirt.
zh: 傑瑞的襯衫上沾著血。

en: His name is Jerry Henry and he is a dementia patient and this is a dementia dream, a dementia attack, and none of this is real, he’s in a nursing home and everything is okay. This isn’t the nursing home.
zh: 他的名字是亨利·傑瑞，他是一個老年痴呆症患者，這是老年痴呆症的夢幻，老年痴呆症在發作，這一切都不是真的，他在一家療養院里，一切正常。

en: The dead girl on the floor is a stranger.
zh: 死在地板上的女孩他不認識。

en: She is facing him. There’s a knife on the floor next to her, this stabbed girl and he wonders, he wonders . . .
zh: 她面對著他，旁邊地上有一把刀，她是被刺死的。

en: He wonders . . . why is he here? He wonders . . . where is here?
zh: 他想知道，他現在在哪裡？

en: He is sitting on a couch in a lounge, just him and the dead girl on the floor, surrounded by nice furniture, nice paintings, all the mod cons of life you can’t take with you. The curtains are closed.
zh: 他坐在客廳的沙發上，這裏只有他和地板上死去的女孩，他們被高檔傢具、精美的油畫環繞，四處都是現代化的生活設施，窗帘拉得嚴嚴實實。

en: The girl is naked. Her hair is blond and her skin is pale and her eyes are blue, so open and so blue.
zh: 女孩全身赤|裸，一頭金髮，皮膚雪白，雙眼睜得那麼大，眼眸是那麼湛藍。

en: There’s a bathrobe on the floor a few feet away from her. It’s speckled with blood.
zh: 她身旁幾英尺遠的地方有件睡衣，上面沾滿鮮血。

en: When he tries to stand he finds that he can’t. His legs aren’t with him, and, and . . . who is this woman?
zh: 他掙扎著想站起來，雙腿卻不像是自己的……這個女人是誰？

en: He looks down at his hands. His left one is curled into a fist. He opens it. Inside is a pair of earrings.
zh: 他低頭看著自己的手，把攥成拳頭的左手張開，裏面是一對鑽石耳環；他的右手血跡斑斑。

en: The knife. The robe. It’s all still here.
zh: 女孩、刀、睡衣，一切都還在這裏。

en: He is Jerry Cutter.
zh: 他是傑瑞·卡特。

en: He is Henry Cutter.
zh: 他是亨利·卡特。

en: He is a crime writer.
zh: 他是一個犯罪小說家。

en: He is a criminal.
zh: 他是一個罪犯。

en: He is the Breaking Man who killed his wife.
zh: 他是個心碎的男人，他親手殺死了自己的妻子。

en: And this girl?
zh: 那麼這個女孩呢？

en: He gets up off the couch.
zh: 他從沙發上爬了起來。

en: The room tilts, not much but enough for him to reach out and grab the wall.
zh: 房間天旋地轉，但不是很嚴重，足以讓他伸手去扶住牆壁。

en: Music is coming from somewhere in the house, something he doesn’t recognize.
zh: 房屋裡響起音樂，那曲子他從來沒聽過。

en: He peeks beyond the curtain to the outside world. It’s daylight out there.
zh: 他透過窗帘凝望著外面的世界，天已經亮了。

en: His name is Jerry Grey.
zh: 他的名字叫傑瑞·格雷。

en: He is lost. He is confused.
zh: 他迷失了，他困惑著。

en: This may look real, it may feel real, but it is not.
zh: 眼前的畫面看起來是真的，感覺也是真的，但事實並非如此。

en: This is the book he wrote. He is inside the pages and soon somebody will save him.
zh: 這是他寫的書，他陷在書頁里，很快會有人來救他的。

en: When he moves, the girl’s eyes follow him until he’s south of her body.
zh: 他一動，女孩的視線就尾隨著他。

en: He crouches next to her and studies her features, this girl, this stranger, who is she?
zh: 他蹲在她身邊，審視她的五官，這個女孩，這個陌生人，她到底是誰？

en: She hasn’t been dead long, but she is dead— there’s no denying that—CPR isn’t going to help.
zh: 但她死了，這一點不用懷疑，心肺復甦也起不了作用。

en: The paramedics could be two seconds away and there’d be nothing they could do except stare at all the blood.
zh: 哪怕急救人員兩秒鐘內就到，也只能看著滿地的鮮血無計可施。

en: She must be in her midtwenties, maybe even thirty. She smells like soap.
zh: 她有二十五六歲，或者三十了，渾身散發著肥皂的氣息。

en: He stands up. He looks around the lounge as though expecting to see an answer, maybe even somebody standing here who can tell him what is going on.
zh: 他站了起來，環視客廳，好像在期盼著看到答案，或者有什麼人站在那裡告訴他是怎麼回事。

en: He has never been here before, he’s sure of it.
zh: 他以前從來沒有來過這個地方，他敢肯定。

en: Henry asks, and he’s had conversations with Henry before. Not in the Before Days, back when things made sense, but the After Days, when the Alzheimer’s really began to take hold.
zh: 他以前曾與亨利交談過，不過不是在寫日記之前，那時他還有意識，而是在寫日記之後，老年痴呆症開始佔據上風。

en: Jerry looks down at his hands. He’s still holding the earrings.
zh: 傑瑞低頭看著他的手，手裡還握著耳環。

en: He tucks them into his pocket.
zh: 他使勁把它們放進口袋。

en: “Is she from one of your books?”
zh: 「她是你書里的人物嗎？」

en: Oh, so it’s my books now, is it?
zh: 「哦，是我的書，對嗎？」

en: “They’ve always been your books,” Jerry tells him.
zh: 「他們都是你書里的人物。」傑瑞告訴他，「她也是嗎？」

en: He sits back down on the couch as Henry thinks about it.
zh: 亨利在思索著，他坐回沙發上。

en: He wonders just how insane he really is. Dementia. Shooting his wife. Confessing to crimes and holding a two-sided conversation with himself.
zh: 他想知道自己瘋到什麼地步了，老年痴呆症啊，他朝自己的妻子開槍、懺悔罪行、自己和自己對話。

en: Who is more crazy—him or Henry?
zh: 誰更瘋一些呢，是他還是亨利？

en: I don’t think this is one of your books, Jerry.
zh: 「我不認為這是你書里的人物，傑瑞。

en: I’m sorry to be the voice of reason here, but it does all seem very— “Real,” Jerry says.
zh: 很抱歉，但我要說出原因，因為這實在是太——」「太真實了。」傑瑞說，「我要報警。」

en: Oh you do, do you?
zh: 「哦，是你乾的，對吧？

en: And tell them what?
zh: 你要告訴他們什麼？

en: For all you know you wandered away from the nursing home, you got lost and confused and you knocked on a random door and when nobody answered you came inside, and this is what you found.
zh: 你所知道的就是你溜出了療養院，懵懵懂懂，渾渾噩噩。你隨便敲了一扇門，沒人應答，你就走了進去，這就是你發現的。

en: If you call the police, they will come here, they will arrest you, and that’s the end of the story.
zh: 如果你打電話報警，他們會來到這裏逮捕你，這就是故事的結局。

en: Even if you didn’t do this, that’s the end of the story.
zh: 即使不是你做的，但結局就是這樣。」

en: “So what do we do?”
zh: 「那麼我們該怎麼辦？」

en: He shakes his head.
zh: 他搖了搖頭。

en: The girl, the wide open eyes, staring at him, studying him. Blaming him.
zh: 那個女孩瞪著眼睛凝視著他、打量著他，在心裏斥責他。

en: “I have to call the police.”
zh: 「我要報警。」

en: You said that already.
zh: 「你說過了。

en: You’ll be in jail before you even know what hit you.
zh: 你還不知道是怎麼回事，就會被關進監獄的。」

en: “I didn’t do this.”
zh: 「我沒有殺人。」

en: I know. I believe you.
zh: 「我知道，我相信你。」

en: “Do you really?”
zh: 「真的嗎？」

en: It could have been a deadbeat boyfriend, or a jealous BFF, or an overly friendly neighbor.
zh: 「也許是他遊手好閒的男友，也許是妒忌她的閨蜜，也許是她太親近的鄰居。」

en: “It could have been anybody,” Jerry says.
zh: 「任何人都有可能。」傑瑞說，「那你有什麼建議嗎？」

en: You’re a crime writer, Jerry. If you get arrested, you can’t use those crime-writing skills to figure out what happened.
zh: 「傑瑞，你是一個犯罪小說家，如果你被逮捕，你就不能動用那些犯罪寫作技巧來搞清楚發生了什麼。

en: You have to run.
zh: 你必須趕緊逃走。」

en: “What does that mean?”
zh: 「這意味著什麼？」

en: If this was a book, what would you do?
zh: 「如果這發生在一本書里，你會怎麼辦？」

en: “Call the police.”
zh: 「報警。」

en: No.
Pretend this isn’t real life. “This is real life.”
zh: 要假裝這不是真的。」

en: Of course it is, but you’re missing my point.
zh: 「當然是真的，但你完全沒有理解我的意思。

en: Are you deliberately being stupid?
zh: 你在故意裝蠢？」

en: Jerry closes his eyes. He can’t stand the dead girl looking at him any longer, but even with his eyes closed he can still feel her gaze.
zh: 傑瑞閉上眼睛，那個死亡的女孩一直在盯著他，他再也受不了了。

en: He looks at the bloody knife on the floor before adjusting the robe to cover the woman’s face too.
zh: 他睜開了眼睛，看著地板上血淋淋的刀。他把睡袍往上拉，蓋住了女人的臉。

en: “What is your point?” he asks Henry.
zh: 「你想說什麼？」他問亨利。

en: And in the books when people should go to the police, what do they do instead?
zh: 「好的。」「在你書里，當人物們應該去報警時，他們會怎麼做呢？」

en: “Anything but go to the police.”
zh: 「做什麼都可以，但就是不報警。」

en: “So what do you suggest I do then?”
zh: 「那我應該怎麼辦呢？你有什麼建議嗎？」

en: Pour gas over everything and burn the place down then get the hell out.
zh: 「在所有的東西上面澆上汽油，把一切都付之一炬，然後趕緊離開這個鬼地方。」

en: Jerry shakes his head. “I’m not doing that.”
zh: 傑瑞搖了搖頭：「我不會那樣做的。」

en: You should. “No.”
zh: 「你應該這樣做。」

en: Then wipe down everything you touched, including the wall where you steadied yourself a few minutes ago.
zh: 「不。」「把你碰過的地方都擦掉，包括你幾分鐘前靠過的牆。

en: Find the laundry and grab some bleach and pour it over her body. Take the knife and dump it a few miles from here.
zh: 找到洗衣房，取一些漂白劑，撒在她身體上；把刀拿走，扔到離這兒幾公裡外的地方。

en: Make your way into town. I have an idea—make your way to the library.
zh: 到城裡去，我有個主意，不妨到圖書館去。

en: “The library?”
zh: 「圖書館？」

en: You used to spend a lot of time there after school, and you used to read book after book, wanting to grow up and be an author.
zh: 你以前放學后常常在那裡打發時光，一本書接一本書地讀，希望長大后成為一名作家。

en: It was those days, those library days, that shaped you into the man you became.
zh: 正是在圖書館里度過的時光，讓你成為你想成為的人。」

en: “Sick?”
zh: 「病人嗎？」

en: An author, you idiot.
zh: 「作家，你這個白痴。」

en: He walks into the dining room.
zh: 他走進餐廳。

en: The music gets louder, and he thinks it’s coming from the bedroom.
zh: 音樂更響亮了，他以為是從卧室里傳來的。

en: There’s a clock on the wall. It’s seven fifty in the morning.
zh: 牆壁上掛著時鐘，現在是早上七點五十分。

en: He carries it into the lounge and looks at the dead woman.
zh: 他拿著漂白劑走進客廳，看著那女人的屍體。

en: How can he pour bleach on somebody whose name he doesn’t know?
zh: 他怎麼能把漂白劑澆在一個不知姓甚名誰的人身上呢？

en: The same way you killed somebody whose name you don’t know. “So I did kill her?”
zh: 「你還用同樣方法殺死了其他一些不知姓甚名誰的人。」

en: It’s possible.
zh: 「有可能。

en: But if you didn’t, then staying here is a mistake.
zh: 但如果你沒有，那麼你就不應該待在這裏。」

en: He heads back into the dining room, then into the hallway, and in the corner by the door is an A Place for Everything shelf that has keys and sunglasses and a handbag on top.
zh: 他轉身走進餐廳，穿過走廊，來到門口的拐角處，儲物櫃最上面一格放著鑰匙、太陽鏡和手提包。

en: He opens the handbag. Inside is a purse, and inside that is a driver’s license. Fiona Clark. Twenty-six years old—the same age as his daughter.
zh: 他打開手提包，裏面是個錢包，錢包里有張駕駛執照，菲奧娜·克拉克，二十六歲，和他女兒年紀相仿。

en: “My name is Jerry Grey and I’m a writer,” he says, putting the license back.
zh: 「我的名字叫傑瑞·格雷，我是一個作家。」他說著，把駕照放回原處，「我的名字叫傑瑞·格雷，這一切都不是真的。」

en: But it is real. There’s a dead girl in the lounge to prove it.
zh: 但這一切都是真的，客廳里女孩的屍體可以證明。
